topSectionSubTitle: Here you can easily find new broadband, while cancelling your old one. See and compare all the options available at your new address!
enterAddress: Enter the address of your new home to view available broadband plans
mobileOrFixed1: The main thing that governs the choice between mobile or fixed broadband is how you will use the broadband. If you are often on the move, and want to be able to be flexible, then mobile broadband is probably the best choice for you.
mobileOrFixed2: Apart from this, it is always the conditions at the address that govern. If there are no fixed alternatives, and it is not relevant to pull in fiber at the address, then mobile broadband may be your only choice.
mobileOrFixed3: However, if you have access to fiber and need fast transfer speeds and unlimited data, you should consider fixed broadband.
suggestedPricePopupText: The monthly unit price is the sum of all costs during the binding period (or during the first year if the bidding period is shorter than 12 months), calculated per month. This includes both fixed start-up fees and ongoing monthly fees.

FAQ.whyOrder: Is broadband included in my rent/monthly fee?
FAQ.whyOrderAnswer: Many tenant-owner associations and landlords have signed a so-called group agreement for broadband. This means that all residents can use the internet for a cost that is often included in the rent/monthly fee to the association.
FAQ.whyOrderAnswerText_2: If there is a group agreement at your new address, you will be informed about it when you get internet at Flyttsmart.se. In other words, you don't have to worry about signing duplicate contracts.
FAQ.whatIsIncluded: How do I cancel my current broadband?
FAQ.whatIsIncludedAnswer: It depends on which broadband provider you have today – the providers have different procedures for termination.
FAQ.whatIsIncludedAnswer_2: In the list below, you can see what applies to your supplier.
FAQ.whatHappensAfterOrder: I have a binding period left. What should I do?
FAQ.whatHappensAfterOrderAnswer: Many broadband subscriptions have a binding period (often 12, 18 or 24 months). This means that you will have to pay for this entire period, even if you want to cancel your subscription early.
FAQ.whatHappensAfterOrderAnswer_2: Suppliers rarely make exceptions when it comes to binding periods. However, it is not impossible that you can move with your current subscription, or transfer it to the person who moves in after you. It is often possible to arrange directly on the supplier's website.

STEPONE.fixesListItemOne: Sign up for an internet plan at your new address.
STEPONE.fixesListItemTwo: Get a router to your new address.
STEPONE.fixesTextSectionTwoTitle: Still in a binding period for your current internet?
STEPONE.fixesTextSectionTwo: Ask your provider if you can bring the subscription to your new address, or transfer it to the person moving in after you.
STEPONE.bindingTimeDescriptionPartOne: Many internet plans have a binding period (usually 12, 18, or 24 months). This means that you must pay for the whole contract period if you cancel the subscription in advance.
STEPONE.bindingTimeDescriptionPartTwo: The binding period of my current internet plan has not expired yet. What should I do?
STEPONE.bindingTimeDescriptionPartThree: Internet service providers rarely make exceptions, however, you might be able to bring the subscription to your new address.
STEPONE.fixesListItemThreeItemOne: Go to the next step to see internet plans available at your new address and sign up for a subscription.
STEPONE.fixesListItemThreeItemTwo: Some of the suggestions come with a router, which is configured for that particular provider. Wifi is usually built into the router.
STEPONE.fixesListItemThreeItemThree: When you have signed up for a new subscription, you will get help canceling your current one.

STEPTWO.suggestionsTitle: What kind of internet plan do you want?
STEPTWO.filterRouterLabel: Only show suggestions where router is provided.
STEPTWO.partnerShipText: The proposals are presented in collaboration with Bredbandsval
STEPTWO.modalSpeedDescription: 100 Mbit/s is a good choice for most people. It is enough for the whole family to surf, stream and work, at the same time.

GROUPDEAL.infoTextOne: A group agreement means that your property has an agreement with the internet service provider. You get internet at a discounted price, or it's already included in your monthly fee.
GROUPDEAL.infoTextTwo: Contact the internet service provider to get started.
GROUPDEAL.modalText: Contact the internet service provider to activate the group agreement. Also, remember to cancel your current internet subscription to avoid double subscription fees.

DISCOUNTDEAL.infoTextOne: Congratulations! You have discounted broadband from {{provider}} at your address.
DISCOUNTDEAL.infoTextTwo: Contact {{provider}} and the property owner to get started!

STEPTWO.chooseType: Select the type of internet plan you want to see results for!
STEPTWO.noOffersTitle: Try to change your choices and try again.
STEPTWO.noOffersText: We can't find any internet offers that match your criteria.
STEPTWO.contactUs: Kontakta oss, om du behöver hjälp.
STEPTWO.streamingServicesIncluded: The following streaming services are included:
STEPTWO.selectableChannels: As well as {{channelLength}} optional channels of the following:
STEPTWO.priceModalListItemOne: The price is in kronor per month and includes a monthly cost and a fixed start-up fee.
STEPTWO.priceModalListItemTwo: The cost is distributed over one year, if the binding period is shorter than 12 months.
STEPTWO.priceModalListItemThree: If the binding period is longer than 12 months, the cost is distributed over the entire binding period.

STEPTHREE.title: Details for start-up
STEPTHREE.chooseFromList: Enter your apartment number from this list
STEPTHREE.chooseDate: Choose the start date for your new broadband
STEPTHREE.aptNumber: Fill in the apartment number of the apartment
STEPTHREE.apartmenNumberInfo: You find the apartmentnumber in your housing contract or on your door. The number should be the same one that the tax agency has. It should be 4 numbers.
STEPTHREE.modalFlatNrInfo: The selected provider requests that you select one of the available apartment numbers. It can be the apartment number that is registered with the Swedish Tax Agency or the internal apartment number that your housing cooperative/landlord uses. Contact your housing cooperative/landlord if you are uncertain of your apartment number.
STEPTHREE.startDateTooFar: Start date must be within {{days}} days from today to be able to proceed with this offer.
STEPTHREE.dateRestrictionInfo: The selected provider requires that the broadband start date is within {{days}} days from today's date. This is to ensure that the installation can be scheduled and the offer's price does not change.
STEPTHREE.dateRestrictionAlternative: If you need a later start date, please contact the provider directly to discuss alternative solutions.
